Remove character from string using ABAP

Posted on October 31, 2014

You can remove a character from a string using the sentence REPLACE. You can replace the character for an empty character.

REPORT zreplace.

PARAMETERS: 
    p_data(20).

REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF '|' IN p_data WITH ''.

This program receives a parameter, if you run the program with this input T|E|S|T:

input

All the occurrences of the character | will be replaced by an empty character:

replace result
